title: It’s time to leave the leap second in the past
description: Here’s why engineers at Meta are supporting a larger community push to stop introducing any new leap seconds.
notes: Time is such a basic premise with so much nuance affected by the physical world. Not only is the digital world we create so fragile but also the physical world is so abstract to hide these incredibly complexities

title: Optimizing For Feelings
description: On seeking meaning beyond metrics
notes:
Wonderful article. I echo all the sentiments. Most software is drab to use because it’s numerical, or factual. But it doesn’t have to be that way. The web can be whimsical!

Great quote:

Georgia O’Keefe put it this way: "I have things in my head that are not like what anyone has taught me... so I decided to start anew."

title: You can create a great looking website while sucking at design
description: How to create great looking websites while having little design skill.
notes:
Useful specific tips for good design:

1. Use a framework - probably tailwind
2. Use wicked blocks for prebuilt components
3. Use Photopea to design any custom graphics

title: Kurt Vonnegut on the 8 "shapes" of stories
description: Before fame, Kurt Vonnegut wrote a master's thesis on the shapes of stories for the anthropology department at the University of Chicago.
notes:
“What uncle Alex found objectionable about so many human beings is that they so seldom noticed it when they were happy,” Vonnegut said.

His uncle made a habit of noticing the good times: When Vonnegut and his family would be drinking lemonade under a tree on a summer day, his uncle would suddenly exclaim, “Wait a minute, stop! If this isn’t nice, I don’t know what is!”

title: One More Try – an experimental skate video
description: An ode to effort.  Clips by Dennis Ludwig, Ryan Neddeau, and Frankie Eder  Skaters: Blake Johnson, Markus Blessing, Ben Nordberg, Walker Ryan, Ray Corey, Carlos…

description: How to Learn to Code

title: Why your daily stand-ups don't work and how to fix them
description: Daily stand-ups are a classic example of learned helplessness. We all know they’re useless, but we tell ourselves “that’s just how things are” and do nothing...
notes:
Prioritise going through the backlog and adjusting according to any blockers.
Stand ups are not about making sure people are working, they should be focused on getting things done and delivering software to the customer.

title: To Become Wise, Do Less!
description: Embrace leisure and abhor the need to always be productive to actually become productive
notes:
Leisure gives the scribe the chance to acquire wisdom; a man with few commitments can grow wise. How can the ploughman become wise, whose sole ambition is to wield the goad, driving his oxen, engrossed in their work, his conversation limited to bullocks, his thoughts absorbed in the furrows he traces and his long evenings spent in fattening heifers?

Sirach 38: 24-26

title: The “je ne sais quoi” of TikTok — Daniel Immke
description: How a misunderstood platform has completely taken over the world.
notes:
I do t use TikTok but walked away with some powerful lessons.
1) Copying features alone will not bring the desired outcome. Focus on what the feature brings to customers.
2) Different platforms can serve different niches even in ones like social media.

title: How to Make Exercise a Daily Habit - zen habits
notes: Consistency ingrains the habit. Better to do little and often than lots and infrequently.
